Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice on cycle superhighway, 8th January
item.description:
Yesterday at about 0830 I was cycling to work as I usually do heading into central along the cycle highway. As I approached the traffic lights to cross over (everyone least favourite part of the cycle highway because of how blind and narrow the corners are) oxestalls street where it meets Evelyn street, I came off my bike on a sheet of ice. In the time it took me to gather myself and my bike off the highway and onto the curb, another 6 people came off their bike. It is unacceptable that the roads are being gritted but the cycle superhighway and the pavements are not. London is supposed to be encouraging Net Zero and therefore prioritising the infrastructure that supports cars rather than pedestrians is bizarre. Please read chapter one of ‘invisible women’, you would save the NHS money in cold weather injuries if you changed this policy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelyn Street, New Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
